laboratory_examinations.findings: Total bilirubin is 4.2 mg/dL. Elevated, previously peaked at 16 mg/dL.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Bilirubin peaked at 16 on Not specified and has since decreased to 4.2.

laboratory_examinations.findings: WBC: 10.1 x 10^9/L, RBC: 2.68 x 10^12/L (low), HGB: 8.8 g/dL (low), HCT: 26.4% (low), Platelet count: 278 x 10^9/L. Presence of anisocytosis and other abnormal features.
ALT (SGPT): 37 U/L, AST (SGOT): 42 U/L (elevated), ALK PHOS: 316 U/L (elevated).
The size and number of metastatic sites in the liver have increased from prior scans.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The largest lesion now measures 9.2 x 6.1 cm, new lesions are seen in the left lobe of the liver.
